passage_text: allele frequency. The allele frequency represents the incidence of a gene variant in a population. Alleles are variant forms of a gene that are located at the same position, or genetic locus, on a chromosome.
Often called gene frequency. A measure of how common an allele is in a population; the proportion of all alleles at one gene locus that are of one specific type in a population.
Definition. noun, plural: alleles. (genetics). One member of a pair (or any of the series) of genes occupying a specific spot on a chromosome (called locus) that controls the same trait.
Allele frequency. Allele frequency is a measure of the relative frequency of an allele on a genetic locus in a population. Usually it is express ed as a proportion or a percentage.
Allele frequency. Allele frequency is a term of population genetics that is used in characterizing the genetic diversity of a species population, or equivalently the richness of its gene pool.
Often called gene frequency. A measure of how common an allele is in a population; the proportion of all alleles at one gene locus that are of one specific type in a population.

Allele. Definition. noun, plural: alleles. (genetics). One member of a pair (or any of the series) of genes occupying a specific spot on a chromosome (called locus) that controls the same trait. Supplement.
